root.title: Oya (е-27)
root.place: It is found out on a barrow near the coast of the river Oya.
root.store: The monument was transferred to Minusinsk museum in 1880. Minusinsk museum, Inv # 31.
root.general: The stone belongs to an epoch of ancient Turks.
root.description: It is made from gray white sandstone. There are 9 lines of text on two sides. There is a sign on one side.
root.size: Height - 1,02 m, length - 0,42-0,44 m, width - 0,39 m.
root.investigation: It is found out in 1880. Investigated by W.Radloff, H.N.Orhun, S.E.Malov, O.V.Subrakova, I.A.Batmanov, and others.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.181.
